name: Cathedral of Cordoba
description: The beautiful historic cathedral in the center of Cordoba, dating back to the 16th century. This magnificent baroque cathedral is one of the most important religious buildings in Argentina.
alt: Cathedral of Cordoba with its impressive baroque architecture

name: Lake San Roque
description: A stunning lake surrounded by mountains, perfect for outdoor activities and relaxation. This artificial lake offers water sports, fishing, and beautiful scenic views.
alt: Lake San Roque surrounded by Cordoba mountains

name: Sierras de Cordoba
address: Cordoba Mountain Range, Córdoba Province, Argentina
description: The magnificent mountain range offering breathtaking views and hiking trails. These ancient mountains provide excellent opportunities for trekking and nature photography.

name: Jesuit Block
description: A UNESCO World Heritage site featuring well-preserved Jesuit buildings from the 17th century. This historic complex showcases colonial architecture and educational heritage.

name: Capilla del Monte
description: Famous for its mystical Uritorco Hill and beautiful natural landscapes. This charming town attracts visitors seeking spiritual experiences and outdoor adventures.
alt: Capilla del Monte town with Uritorco Hill in background

name: National University of Cordoba
address: Haya de la Torre s/n, X5000 Córdoba, Argentina
description: Founded in 1613, it's the oldest university in Argentina with beautiful historic buildings. This prestigious institution represents centuries of academic excellence and architectural beauty.
alt: National University of Cordoba historic campus

name: Cerro de la Cruz
description: A scenic viewpoint offering panoramic views of the Punilla Valley and surrounding mountains. This popular hiking destination provides spectacular sunrise and sunset views.
alt: Cerro de la Cruz viewpoint overlooking Punilla Valley

name: Estancia Jesuítica de Caroya
description: A historic Jesuit estancia showcasing colonial agricultural practices and architecture. This UNESCO World Heritage site preserves 17th-century farming traditions and religious heritage.
alt: Estancia Jesuítica de Caroya historic colonial buildings
